greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of unrooted hypertrees on n labeled vertices with k hyperedges, n >= 2, 1 <= k <= n-1.
comment: See A210586 for the definition of a hypertree and for the enumeration of rooted hypertrees.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1276
R. Bacher, On the enumeration of labelled hypertrees and of labelled bipartite trees, arXiv:1102.2708 [math.CO], 2011.
J. McCammond and J. Meier, The hypertree poset and the l^2-Betti numbers of the motion group of the trivial link, Mathematische Annalen 328 (2004), no. 4, 633-652.
formula: E.g.f. A(x,t) = t + x*t^2/2! + (x + 3*x^2)*t^3/3! + ..., where t*d/dt(A(x,t)) is the e.g.f. for A210586.
Dobinski-type formula for the row polynomials: R(n,x) = exp(-n*x)*sum {k = 0..inf} n^(k-1)*k^(n-1)x^k/k!.
example: Example of a hypertree with two hyperedges, one a 2-edge {3,4) and one a 3-edge {1,2,3}.
T(4,2) = 12. The twelve unrooted hypertrees on 4 vertices {1,2,3,4} with 2 hyperedges (one a 2-edge and one a 3-edge) have hyperedges:
maple: for n from 2 to 10 do seq(A210587(n, k), k = 1..n-1) end do;
mathematica: Table[T[n, k], {n, 2, 10}, {k, 1, n - 1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 19 2019 *)
program: for(n=2, 10, for(k=1, n-1, print1(T(n, k), ", ")); print); \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 28 2018
results.author: _Peter Bala_, Mar 26 2012
